biocGO 0.0.4
  • Get started
  • Reference

biocGO – a pkgdown site describing relations between Gene Ontology and Bioconductor

This site will collect basic information on the use of GO in Bioconductor.

Use the “Get started” tab above to see the main vignette.

Briefly, Bioconductor provides Gene Ontology resources in several ways.

  • First, GO.db is an annotation package providing convenient maps between GO tags and terms in the molecular function, biological process, and cellular component ontologies. The fundamental representation is in SQLite, and AnnotationDbi defines the API for querying the ontology.

  • Second, org.Hs.eg.db provides mappings from human genes to gene ontology tags, as defined at NCBI.

  • Third, the GO (bioc 3.13) biocViews entry lists packages that declare Gene Ontology as a key concept addressed by the package.

  • Additionally, the OBO representation of terms and relationships between them is ingested using the ontologyIndex API and serialized for users in the ontoProc Bioconductor package.
